answers.answer: It could be the way of a singleton, if you have low iron, or if you are feeling the hormones more than the last two times.  Were the babies before the same gender?  You might be having a baby of the other gender.

I had a boy, then a girl. I've been talking to friends and they've said that number three baby is a wild card. So I'm guessing I'm just paranoid and over thinking things. I get my blood tested tomorrow, so we'll see if I'm low in iron. I was at the end of my last pregnancy, but I've been so nauseous I don't want to supplement til I know for sure

If you can't keep iron down in pill form and need to take it (if your test shows you are anemic), ask about getting an iron shot.  They give you a big bruise-looking thing that lasts seemingly forever, but mercifully you don't puke the darn pill up daily.

I'm the same, also my 3rd.I also have the added concern that my uterus is measuring 5+ weeks ahead! Hubby is freaking it's twins. I'm worried about having gestational diabetes again. Pretty sure our days are right but will find out at scan next week.
Thanks all for your input! I find out Monday, but it seems an age away. I'm curious to see if my suspicions are right!

question: Any one else in the depths of fatigue? I'm 11w 1d and SO incredibly exhausted. I need to sleep all the time. This is my third pregnancy, so I live for the weekends when hubby is home and I can nap :). During the week I'm on full zombie mode. I have an ultrasound in a week and I'm scared it might be twins with how exhausted I am. Any mom's with twins have similar experience? Or is this just the way of a Singleton?
title: Fatigue ... Twins?
